captions.text: Oh, is it an apocalyptic story?

Well, it's those who are left after
whatever happened happened.
What it's all about, I have no idea.
I'm waiting to see what it is.
Looks like a girl's sleeping or lying down.

She goes to bed with her eyelashes on.
That's a typical teenager.

(Joel speaking loudly) 
He is the contractor.

(speaking softly) 
He is the contractor, okay?

(Joel) Let's talk about 
this in the morning, okay?
Oh, okay, he put a light on.
(sighing) What are you still doing up?

He looks like he's 
a computer generated character.
Maybe not, but no-- I don't know.

You kept complaining 
about your broken watch...
That's a very sweet, thoughtful daughter.
I think it's stuck. It's not--
Where did you get the money for this?

You can start helping out 
with the mortgage then.
Okay, she's going back to sleep.

So everything that happens 
now is a dream. (laughs)

Two sweet moments.
I like that.
Well, I'm waiting for the game.

- The girl's asleep.
- (in game: phone rings)

- Feel like I should be ready.
- (Sarah) Hello?

(Tommy) Sara, honey, I need to get 
your daddy on the phone.
Uncle Tommy, what time is it?

(Tommy) I need to talk to your dad now!
There's something--

It's a movie.
It's not a game.
Something's gonna happen in the mirror.

She's getting up, but why 
hasn't she gone
for her father and talk to him.
She's not trying to get her father.

She's not contacting 
her father like she should.

(Finebros) You actually need 
to use the controller to move.

Oh, am I supposed to be
doing something with this?
Oh, now I'm supposed to be her.

I see now.
Okay, that's how it works.
Okay. Okay, now I'm getting it.

All right, go on.
Go walk ahead.

Come on, come on.
Get your dad.

There seems to be light 
coming out on the side.

(reporter) ...seem to be somehow connected
to the nationwide pandemic.

- Hey, move!
- (reporter) There seems to be

- some commotion coming from beh--
- (man) Get the hell out of here right--
(man) Get out of here right now--

Look out the window.
There's an explosion.

- (in game: dogs bark, sirens wail)
- That's amazing!
Oh, we could feel the shotgun or the bomb.

Now, I don't know if this 
is the right thing to do, to look.

If there's another explosion 
and the glass breaks
They said something about a gas leak,
so maybe there was a gas explosion.

'Cause dad's not upstairs,
so maybe he's downstairs.

- (Sarah) What is goin' on?
- Yeah, what is going on?
I don't know what is going on. (chuckles)

- (in game: police car sirens wail)
- Made it downstairs.

Oh, here come the police.
Oh my goodness.

What's going on out there?
Where's your daddy?
Open it, don't bump on it!
(Finebros) You can't go out that door.
Can I go out the back door, maybe?
(Sarah gasps in fear at a sudden noise)
Oh, she's really starting to get panicky.

- (Sarah) There you are!
- Ah, pop finally arrived.
(Sarah) No, who would come in here?

Yeah, she's getting scared.
I don't blame her.

- (thumping against glass)
- Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh!

Oh my gosh!
Shoot him! Shoot him!
Her father shot the guy that came in.

(voice trembling)
I saw him this morning.

- There is something bad going on.
- You bet!

(Joel) We have got to get outta here.
Do you understand me?
I wonder if there's a disease.
I mean, it was an explosion, I thought.
You have any idea what's goin' on out there?

- (Joel) I got some notion.
- Oh, is this Tommy?
(Tommy) You got blood all over you.

(Joel) It ain't mine.
Let's just get outta here.
Yeah, let's get out of here.

(Tommy) ...half the people
in the city have lost their minds.
Half the people lost their minds?
(Tommy) Some sort of parasite or somethin'.
Some sort of parasite, they think.

Must be like a Body Snatcher thing 
or those walking zombies they turn into?
It's zombie talk to me, man.

I don't have to steer it 
and do all that stuff.
Oh, the road's on fire up ahead.

- Wow, or a house is on fire.
- (Tommy) That's Louis' farm.

Ooh, Louis' farm 
doesn't look all that good.
This looks like it's happening all over.

- (Joel) No, of course not.
- (Sarah) How do you know?

(Tommy) They said it's 
just, ah, people in the city.
(Sarah) Didn't Jimmy work in the city?

I guess they feel the disease 
is coming from the city.

Well, I guess country people would 
always blame the cities for diseases.

(Joel) What the hell 
do you think you're doing?
(Joel) You ain't seen what I seen.

I don't know where this sign is.
"San Antonio".

(Tommy) Everyone and their mother 
had the same damn idea.
See, they're all trying to get out of town.
(man) Hey, what the [bleep], man? Let's go!

Oh, go! Go!
Get out of the way.

- (in game: screams of pain)
- Oh, goodness!

- Oh my god!
- (in game: scream of pain)

(Tommy) What the [bleep] just happened?!
Did you see that?

Did you see it?"
I didn't see it.
I don't know if she saw it.

But you know what?
That language is foul.
Okay, there are people all over the place.

- (Joel) Get us outta here.
- (Tommy) I'm tryin'.

- (Tommy groans in frustration)
- Ai yi yi.

This language is not the best, 
but they're very excited.

Go up over the curb!
You've got a truck!
The father looks like he might be dead.
All right, the girl got up.

Do it again.
Kick that window out.
Hit him. Attack of the zombies.
Come on, give me your hand.

- (Sarah gasps in pain)
- (Joel) What is it?
Oh, she's got a broken leg. Oh no.

Well, they're a lot faster 
than the zombies, I'll tell you.
She doesn't even know what happening.

(chuckles) We gave him the gun,
and now he's gone.
It's look like the writer are confused.
Now they don't know what to do. (laughs)
They have to make up a story.

People are running, 
but are they running after people
Well, there's a guy who's biting him.

- (in game: screams of panic)
- I've been resurrected!

Oh, they are in Texas.
There's Texan Gas there.
Do I have to do something?

(Finebros) Use the controller 
and follow Tommy.

- (in game: woman shrieks)
- Okay, go in.
I wonder if he can run a little faster.
He could be running faster than that, man.
I go to the left, there is a zombie.
I go to the right, there is zombie.

- (people shriek)
- (Sarah) Those people are on fire.
(Joel) Just keep looking at me, baby.
(Joel) We're gonna get out of this.

Catch up to Tommy.
Hurry up!

(Tommy) Get back!
There's too many of 'em.
Now they're saying run this way.
Okay, he's taking them through the alley.
Ooh! No! No! No! No! No! No!
Get away! Get away! Get away! Get away!
This way, this way, this way.
Okay, the brother's holding them off
and the father's taking the little girl.

Go through here.
Go through here.

Go through here.
It's an opening.

No, no, don't stop.
Keep going.
Go past him! Past him! Past him!
I don't know who knocked those guys out.

It's my daughter.
I think her leg is broken.

(soldier) We got a couple of civilians 
in the outer perimeter.

We're gonna get you to safety 
and go back for him, okay?

(soldier in grave tone) 
Sir...there's a little girl.
The soldier's gonna shoot them down.

- Ai yi yi yi yi yi.
- (Joel) Please, don't.

- (Sarah yelps in pain)
- I know, baby, I know.

You're gonna be okay, baby.
Stay with me!

- I'm gonna pick you up.
- (Sarah screams)

(Joel) I know, baby.
I know it hurts.

Don't do this to me, baby.
Don't do this--
Sarah just bit the big one.

This is sick.
This is sick.

It was good.
It was exciting.
I thought it was a little bit too dark.
I would've liked a little more light.
This is the first game that I really like.

This is the first game 
I've ever played that had a story.
So, yeah, I think I liked that.
This game was much more emotional.
It was much more gut wrenching.
I felt like it was more real.

It's quite amazing to me
because it's like watching a movie

and you wanna get up there 
and be with the characters

and say, "Ooh, I wanna do this.
I wanna do that."

And this lets you do that.
It's pretty darn amazing.

Thanks for watching us play 
The Last of Us on the React channel.

For new gaming episodes every week,
be sure to subscribe.
What game do you want us to try next?
Let us know in the comments.
